description: This file is an Android activity written in Kotlin for a Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) scanning app. It manages UI components, handles permissions, and interacts with a BleManager class to perform BLE device scans.

classes.name: MainActivity
classes.description: Primary activity managing Bluetooth scanning UI and interactions.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes UI components, sets up button click listeners, and initializes the BleManager object.

methods.name: onStop
methods.description: Stops Bluetooth scanning when the activity is no longer visible to avoid resource leaks.

methods.name: startScanNoFilter
methods.description: Starts BLE scanning with a callback for scan events and updates UI accordingly.

methods.name: setStatus
methods.description: Updates the status TextView with a message.

methods.name: requestEnableBluetooth
methods.description: Requests the user to enable Bluetooth via system intent.

methods.name: hasRequiredBlePermissions
methods.description: Checks whether the app has necessary BLE permissions based on Android version.

methods.name: requestRequiredBlePermissions
methods.description: Requests BLE-related runtime permissions from the user.

methods.name: onRequestPermissionsResult
methods.description: Handles user's response to permission requests.

methods.name: onActivityResult
methods.description: Handles the result of Bluetooth enable request.
